info:
When riding in a group with several motorcycles, you should ride offset to increase the safety distance.In order not to overstrain inexperienced riders and thus put them in a dangerous situation, the group has to follow their riding style.

There are traffic situations, such as a red light, where a group cannot stay together.
text: What must be observed when several motorcycles are travelling together in a group?

asw_1: The driver of the red vehicle fails to see me
asw_2: The green truck performs a turn
asw_3: The tractor moves onto the road
info: There is no sign that the tractor is driving on the road or that the truck is turning.The driver of the oncoming and turning vehicle had his view obscured by the truck, he could have overlooked me and turned off immediately.
text: What should you anticipate in this situation?

asw_1: I interrupt the journey to take an adequate break
asw_2: I allow a co-driver to drive, if possible
asw_3: I decide against taking a break, and fight the tiredness
info: In the case of fatigue, only recovery helps. The body must be given an appropriately long break.
text: What is the right thing to do if you sense signs of fatigue during a night-time journey?

asw_1: - exhibits a calm and relaxed driving style
asw_2: - refrains from responding to provocations on the road
asw_3: - always informs other traffic participants of their driving errors
info: A good driver is considerate of other motorists and drives defensively. A risky driving style is not permitted.
text: How can you recognise a good driver?

asw_1: When a lane comes to an end
asw_2: If one lane is not continuously free to traffic due to an obstacle
asw_3: When a merging lane ends on the motorway
info: On roads with several lanes for one direction, if it is not possible to drive continuously on one lane or if one lane ends, the vehicles prevented from continuing should be allowed to pass over to the adjacent lane in such a way that these vehicles can alternate with a vehicle travelling on the continuous lane immediately before the narrowing begins (zipper feed-in method).
text: You are driving on a road that has several marked lanes going in one direction. When should the alternate merging procedure be employed?

asw_1: - walking speed
asw_2: - at 20 km/h maximum
asw_3: - at 30 km/h maximum
asw_pretext: If cyclists or pedestrians are anticpated, at
text: You are driving a motor vehicle with a gross vehicle weight rating in excess of 3.5 t. At what speed do you have to turn right within a built-up area?

asw_1: - may not obstruct anyone
asw_2: - may not fall over
asw_3: - must be positioned on the sidewalk
info: A safe stand must be ensured during parking. For this reason, the parking area should have a solid base.
text: What do you have to consider when parking your motorbike?

asw_1: - remove the ignition key
asw_2: - close the steering lock
asw_3: - disconnect the battery
info: Remove the ignition key and lock the steering lock to prevent unauthorized use.The battery is quickly reconnected and disconnecting it therefore does not provide protection against unauthorized use.
text: How do you secure your motorcycle against being used without permission?

asw_1: The gradient of the parking place
asw_2: The characteristics of the ground surface
asw_3: That the prop stand is completely folded away before driving off
info: All three answers are correct.Motorcycles must always be parked safely and stable, the ground must not give way.A side stand that is not completely folded in can cause obstructions while riding.
text: What must you be aware of when using a prop stand?

asw_1: A malfunctioning car with assisted steering is difficult to steer
asw_2: When towing an electric vehicle, it is necessary to following the manufacturer’s guidelines
asw_3: Driving licence class BE is the minimum required in order to tow a car
info:
If the motor fails, the brake booster is not available. In order to achieve a comparable braking force, applying a higher pedal pressure is necessary. Towing by means of a tow bar creates a connection that acts between the vehicles in both directions and thus provides some support during braking.

If an electric vehicle is towed, the manufacturer's instructions must be observed.
text: Your car has an engine fault and must be towed away with a tow rope. What must you be aware of?

asw_1: The passing beam
asw_2: Only the parking light
asw_3: The driving beam
info: The headlights must be switched on.Driving with the parking light alone is not allowed. The illumination of the road is insufficient and at the same time there is a risk of being recognized late by oncoming traffic.The high beam may only be switched on on roads which do not have a continuous, sufficient illumination. In case of oncoming traffic, the high beam must always be switched off immediately.
text: As a basic rule, what lights of a motor vehicle must be turned on when driving in darkness?

asw_1: I pull carefully up behind the last car in the traffic jam
asw_2: I drive carefully through the emergency corridor
asw_3: I continue driving carefully along the hard shoulder
info: It is important to open the door carefully and to maintain the necessary safety distance. Motorcycles are not allowed to "wiggle" between the vehicles or drive on the hard shoulder.
text: You are approaching a traffic jam on the motorway. What is the right course of action?

asw_1: The motorbike must be licensed to carry 2 people
asw_2: The pillion rider must be capable of riding with you
asw_3: A child pillion rider over 7 years of age, must be able to use the existing footrests and hand grips
info:
All three answers are correct.

Another person can only be taken along if the motorcycle has the appropriate registration. The passenger must wear a safety helmet.
text: What must you be aware of if you want to take a pillion rider with you?

asw_1: It is more difficult to keep the motorbike stable
asw_2: Its behaviour changes when braking
asw_3: There is a reduction in its sensitivity to side winds
info: Due to the increased mass, the motorcycle only becomes stabilized at higher speeds. The enlarged surface increases the susceptibility to wind. The braking behaviour of the motorcycle can also change.
text: How does riding with a pillion rider affect the handling of a motorbike?

asw_1: The infant carrier must be positioned reversed to the direction of travel
asw_2: If installed, the passenger airbag must be deactivated
asw_3: The baby must be strapped into the infant carrier
info: All three answers are correct.In passenger seats where an operational airbag is installed in front, rearward-facing baby restraints must not be installed, i.e. the passenger airbag must be deactivated.Of course, the baby must be strapped in the baby carrier.
text: You want to drive with a baby in the passenger seat. What do you have to be aware of when using an infant carrier?

asw_1: The luggage net
asw_2: The tensioning belt
asw_3: The anti-slip mat
info: All three answers are correct.Luggage net, tension belt and anti-slip mat are suitable for securing loads.
text: What can be used to secure loads carried in a car?

asw_1: - stow the warning triangle in an easily accessible place
asw_2: - place heavy luggage at the bottom
asw_3: - secure the luggage against slipping
info: All three answers are correct.The warning triangle must be ready to hand at all times.In order to avoid endangering the occupants, e.g. in the event of a hazard braking maneuver, luggage should be secured against slipping and heavy luggage should be stowed as far down as possible.
text: What should you remember when loading luggage into a car luggage compartment?

asw_1: To help with the road-worthy loading of the vehicle
asw_2: To avoid falling below the axle load limit of the vehicle
asw_3: To determine the unloading sequence for the vehicle
text: What is the purpose of a load distribution plan?

asw_1: The tyres may become damaged
asw_2: The steering ability may be affected
asw_3: Its braking performance may be adversely affected
text: What could happen if your vehicle is not loaded according to the load distribution plan?

asw_1: Information about the centre of gravity of the load at the maximum allowable load limit
asw_2: Information about securing the load on the load platform
asw_3: Information about the maximum height of the load on the load platform
text: What specific information can you find in a load distribution plan?

asw_1: A closely fitting motorcycle jacket
asw_2: Back protector
asw_3: Low shoes
info: The safety equipment includes a suitable jacket equipped with protectors, for example. Suitable motorcycle trousers are also included as part of the safety equipment.
text: What should be included as suitable protective clothing for a motorcyclist?

asw_1: - serious foot injuries can occur if the motorcycle tips over while stationary
asw_2: - any accident insurance claims may be reduced
asw_3: - the operation of the vehicle can be restricted by weather conditions
info:
Motorcycle boots provide adequate protection even when stationary, should the motorcycle tip over.

They also protect against hypothermia and the associated damage to one’s health.

If no suitable motorcycle boots have been worn, the insurance claim may be at risk.
text: Why should you wear suitable motorcycle boots when riding a motorcycle?

asw_1: - restrict vision
asw_2: - increase glare
asw_3: - will cause the visor to become more misted up
info: Scratches in the visor worsen one's view. In addition, the risk of glare from the sun or oncoming traffic increases considerably.
text: Why should you replace a scratched helmet visor?

asw_1: - an appropriate, good fitting motorcycle helmet
asw_2: - a well maintained motorcycle cap
asw_3: - an officially inspected work safety helmet
info: An approved safety helmet must be worn to protect against head injuries.
text: What must you do to protect yourself against head injuries?

asw_1: - the telephone in not held in my hand for this purpose
asw_2: - using the telephone only requires a momentary glance
asw_3: - the telephone is not used for longer than 7 seconds here
asw_pretext: I may use the telephone if
info: Anyone driving a vehicle may not use a mobile or car telephone if the mobile telephone or the handset of the car telephone must be picked up or held for this purpose. This does not apply if the vehicle is stationary and the engine is switched off in the case of motor vehicles. Operation of the device may create a distraction that could endanger road safety.
text: You receive a telephone call while driving. What must you be aware of?

asw_1: The accessory equipment must be put into the transport position and secured there
asw_2: The maximum gross axle weight rating must be observed
asw_3: The pedals of the single-wheeled brakes must be disengaged
text: You want to drive your agricultural tractor with attached accessory equipment. What must you be aware of before driving off?

asw_1: - remove such dirt without delay
asw_2: - adequately indicate the dirty area until the dirt can be removed
asw_3: - always notifiy the office of public order of such soiling
text: You have dirtied the public highway with your agricultural vehicle. This is endangering or impeding traffic. What do you have to do?

asw_1: I reduce my speed further
asw_2: I drive as far to the left as possible
asw_3: I continue driving just as before
info: The accident site is located in the immediate vicinity of the road. Therefore, it is important to reduce your speed in order not to endanger anyone. This can be done by driving far to the left.
text: What is the right course of action now?

asw_1: Vehicles ahead that may swerve out suddenly to the left
asw_2: Vehicles ahead that may brake suddenly
asw_3: Tree branches lying on the roadway
info: All three answers are correct.The danger sign "101-54 insufficient clearance gauge" warns of branches in the airspace above the road.Therefore, braking and evasive vehicles as well as branches on the road must be expected.
text: What should you anticipate when you see this road sign?

asw_1: Motor vehicles with a green particulate emissions sticker
asw_2: Motorcycles
asw_3: Motor vehicles that meet the requirements for a green particulate emissions sticker, even if no such sticker is attached
info: Motorcycles do not need an environmental sticker. Only four-wheeled vehicles need a sticker and are allowed to enter the environmental zone with a green particulate matter sticker.
text: What motor vehicles may enter an environment zone that has this sign?

asw_1: Attending a practical driving training session for a fuel-efficient driving style
asw_2: Using vehicles with an electric drive
asw_3: Forming car pools
info: All three answers are correct.All measures that reduce pollutant emissions contribute to environmentally friendly driving.
text: What can contribute to environmentally-friendly driving?

asw_1: Do not press down hard on the accelerator when moving off
asw_2: Use the eco mode when driving
asw_3: Switch off the engine when driving down a gradient
info:
During "kick down", the engine shifts down and accelerates at maximum speed, which increases fuel consumption enormously. Therefore, avoiding "kick downs" is considered fuel-efficient.

If the engine of a car with automatic transmission is switched off while driving, transmission damage may occur.
text: How can you save fuel if you drive a car with an automatic gearbox?

asw_1: I am committing a criminal offence for driving without a licence
asw_2: I am committing an administrative offence because I have no authorisation to operate the moped
asw_3: None, provided I do not drive any faster than 25 km/h
info: Because motor vehicles can drive faster than 25 km/h after they have been tuned to do so, there is a risk of punishment for driving without a driving licence. The technical modifications result in the cancellation of the operating permit and insurance cover. There is also a threat of punishment and a fine.
text: The maximum design speed of a moped exceeds 25 km/h due to a prohibited technical modification. What are the consequences for me if I ride such a moped on public roads?

asw_1: - towable weight of the towing vehicle
asw_2: - vertical load of the hitch
asw_3: - load of the trailer
info: All three answers are correct.The maximum trailer load and the permissible drawbar load of the trailer coupling are entered in the vehicle registration document or in the registration certificate of the towing vehicle. These values must not be exceeded.
text: You want to pull a trailer. What must you be aware of?

asw_1: - applicable conditions for inner city road use (a city toll for example)
asw_2: - labelling requirements for driving in environment zones
asw_3: - applicable speed limits
asw_pretext: When abroad, there may be different
info: All three answers are correct.Speed restrictions, environmental zones and city tolls are regulated very differently abroad. A violation can lead to sometimes drastic fines.
text: What must you be aware of when route planning abroad?

asw_1: Wearing a suitable crash helmet is mandatory
asw_2: Quads are prone to tipping over when driving through tight bends
asw_3: The handling characteristics are similar to those of a car
info: The driving characteristics of a quad bike do not correspond to those of a car in many areas.Since one cannot "lay" oneself with Quads, contrary to the motorcycle, into the curve, there is the danger of "tilting" outward by centrifugal force.Wearing a protective helmet is mandatory.STVO §21a, 2:Anyone who drives motorcycles or open three- or multi-wheeled motor vehicles with a maximum design speed of over 20 km/h as well as riding on or in them must wear a suitable safety helmet while driving.This does not apply if mandatory safety belts are worn.
text: What must you be aware of when driving a quad?

asw_1: Protective motorcycle clothing should be worn
asw_2: A warning triangle must be carried on the quad
asw_3: The necessary steering force can be significantly greater than with a car
info: All three answers are correct.A first aid kit (§ 35h StVZO) and a warning triangle (§ 53a StVZO) must be carried.Since there is usually no power steering, the steering forces can be much higher than in a car.
text: What should be observed when driving a quad?

asw_1: I place my hand on the handbrake lever
asw_2: I place my foot over the brake pedal
asw_3: I change up to a higher gear
info: You are ready to brake when your hand is resting on the brake lever. The same applies if the foot is placed over the brake pedal.
text: You are driving a motorbike with a manual gearbox. What do you have to do in order to be ready to brake?

asw_1: An unequal distribution of weight should be avoided
asw_2: Heavier pieces of luggage should be stowed as close to the bottom as possible
asw_3: The gross vehicle weight rating of the motorcycle may not be exceeded
info:
All three answers are correct.

The use of side-mounted suitcases or panniers requires an even weight distribution on both sides. Heavy luggage should be stowed as low as possible.The maximum speed and total mass recommended by the manufacturer must also be taken into account.
text: You want to use a carrying case or pannier affixed to the side of your motorcycle. What must you be especially aware of?

asw_1: My vehicle is getting close to the road markings at the side of the road
asw_2: My vehicle is undercutting the safety distance to the vehicle ahead
asw_3: Another vehicle is overtaking me with not enough side clearance
info: Lane Keeping Assistant is a driver assistance system that warns the driver of a vehicle before leaving the lane. It does not react to the lateral distance to other vehicles.The safety distance to the vehicle in front is controlled by the Distance Measurement Assistant.
text: The lane keeping assist system warns you with acoustic, haptic or optical signals. What might be the cause of this?

asw_1: My vehicle must be fitted with winter tyres
asw_2: All entry/exit steps must be clear of snow and ice prior to use
asw_3: The vehicle must be filled with a sufficient amount of windscreen antifreeze
text: What must you be aware of when operating your motor vehicle in wintry conditions?

asw_1: I drop down the gears in plenty of time
asw_2: I use the permanent brake
asw_3: I use the parking brake
text: You are driving a motor vehicle with a manual gearbox. How do you conserve the service brake when driving down a long downward slope?

asw_1: I shut down the engine immediately
asw_2: I check the engine oil level
asw_3: I continue driving until the next oil change
info: The oil pressure indicator light warns the driver if the oil pressure is too low. This can lead directly to engine damage. The engine must be switched off immediately and the oil level must be checked.
text: What must you do if the oil pressure warning light fails to switch off after starting the engine?

asw_1: If the brake fluid level in the reservoir has dropped considerably
asw_2: If no pressure point is felt when pulling the brake lever
asw_3: If the brake control light illuminates while you are driving
info: All three answers are correct.The level of the brake fluid and a missing pressure point pose a risk.A brake indicator light that lights up indicates a defect in the brake system.
text: When it is necessary to check the braking system of your motorcycle immediately?

asw_1: If the brake control light illuminates while driving
asw_2: If my car fails to stay in line when I brake
asw_3: If I performed an emergency braking manoeuvre with my car
info: The lighting up of the brake indicator light and one-sided braking (vehicle does not stay on track when braking) require the brake system to be checked.
text: When should you arrange for the braking system of your car to be checked?

asw_1: You should stop at a suitable place as soon as possible, and follow the guidelines of the manufacturer
asw_2: Continue driving slowly at a higher engine speed to improve cooling
asw_3: Continue driving in low gear to the next scheduled break of journey
text: What should you do if the engine temperature warning light illuminates while you are driving?

asw_1: - drive in a low gear without pressing the clutch if at all possible
asw_2: - repeatedly start and stop driving
asw_3: - drive slowly with the clutch slipped
info: The less the clutch is actuated, the less wear and tear.Repeated starting and stopping puts a strain on the clutch.
text: You are in a traffic jam, driving at walking speed. When is the least wear exerted on the clutch of your manual transmission vehicle?

asw_1: - sight-glass
asw_2: - oil dipstick
asw_3: - instant fuel consumption display
asw_pretext: Depending on the motorcycle, by checking the
info: Depending on the vehicle, the engine oil level can be checked at the sight glass or the oil dipstick.
text: How can you check the engine oil level?

asw_1: - driver information system
asw_2: - oil dipstick
asw_3: - instant fuel consumption display
asw_pretext: Depending on the motor vehicle, by checking the
info: Depending on the vehicle, the engine oil level can be checked at the driver information system or the Oil Dipstick.
text: How can you check the engine oil level?

asw_1: The motorcycle’s handling will be poorer
asw_2: Tyre wear is increased
asw_3: The reaction distance is lengthened
info: Both too high and too low tyre pressure can increase tyre wear. A deterioration of the driving behaviour is also possible.
text: What can be the consequences of having too much or too little air pressure in the tyres of the motorcycle?

asw_1: - always be activated
asw_2: - only be activated in heavy traffic
asw_3: - never be activated on motorways
text: Your motor vehicle is equipped with an emergency brake assist. Which is correct?

asw_1: - always be activated
asw_2: - only be activated in dangerous situations
asw_3: - only be activated with the onset of tiredness

asw_1: - operates without wear
asw_2: - can relieve the service braking device
asw_3: - can brake the vehicle to a standstill

asw_1: It reduces the probability of rear-end collisions
asw_2: The driver is assisted in maintaining the chosen distance
asw_3: It means that the safety distance cannot be undercut
text: What is the benefit of using adaptive cruise control (ACC) on motorways?

asw_1: Selecting the right gear
asw_2: Using the cruise control in stop-and-go traffic conditions
asw_3: Accelerating in good time at long inclines

asw_1: 1.5 mm
asw_2: 1.0 mm
asw_3: 2.0 mm

text: In which case are motor vehicles or combination vehicles used in road haulage, subject to a toll charge?
You are driving a bus used in the occasional carriage of passengers. After 4 1/2 hours of continuous driving, for how long must the driving time be interrupted, before you can continue driving again?
You are driving a combination vehicle with a maximum authorised combination mass of 24 t. What is the longest time before you must interrupt your driving time for a break?

asw_1: I reduce my speed
asw_2: I avoid strong acceleration
asw_3: I reduce the safety distance to the vehicle ahead
info: Heavy rain worsens visibility and grip. I therefore reduce my speed and avoid accelerating hard.Reducing the safety distance to the vehicle in front is therefore exactly the wrong thing to do.
text: While driving, it suddenly begins to rain heavily. What should you do?

asw_1: - estimate the distance away of an oncoming vehicle as being too great
asw_2: - estimate the speed of an oncoming vehicle as being too low
asw_3: - estimate my overtaking distance to be shorter than it is
info:
Because the vehicle to be overtaken is also in motion, the overtaking distance is often underestimated. The distance to oncoming traffic is also often overestimated.

Overtaking is only allowed if you can ensure that any oncoming traffic will not be obstructed during the entire time that you are overtaking.
text: Why can it be dangerous to overtake on an unobscured, straight road?

asw_1: I allow the red vehicle to turn
asw_2: I allow the electric scooter to cross the road
asw_3: I am the first to cross over the junction
info: If you want to turn, you have to yield to oncoming vehicles, rail vehicles, electric bicycles and cyclists even if they are riding or driving on or beside the road in the same direction. This also applies to scheduled buses and other vehicles using marked special lanes. Special consideration must be given to pedestrians. If necessary, wait.
text: You want to continue driving straight ahead. What is the correct course of action in this situation?

asw_1: - drivers only see me late
asw_2: - I only see vehicles late
asw_3: - drivers give my priority in re-joining the road
asw_pretext: When they approach me from the rear
info: Vehicles parked in a row can impair visibility. Vehicles that leave the parking row may not be recognised by other motorists until later. On the other hand, i.e., when leaving the parking space, visibility may be impaired, making it difficult to detect approaching traffic early.
text: I want to re-join the road. What is the correct assessment of this situation?

asw_1: Because secondary accidents can occur
asw_2: Because pedestrians can be overlooked
asw_3: Because the traffic movement situation is unclear
info: The traffic situation is unclear.Therefore, all three answers are correct.
text: Why is it dangerous to carry on driving past this accident scene?

asw_1: I only continue driving once I have reassured myself that the road is clear
asw_2: I do not have to reassure myself that the road is clear, because the cyclist is moving
asw_3: I may no longer continue using the cycle path
info:
This is a question only for the class Mofa! So you are riding a Mofa.

I cannot rely on other road users to behave properly and I have to see for myself whether the road is clear.

Outside towns and cities, Mofas are allowed to use bike lanes.
text: You are driving outside of a built-up area. What is the correct course of action in this situation?

asw_1: The incline causes the cyclists to sway
asw_2: I must overtake with at least 1.5 m of side clearance
asw_3: I must overtake with at least 1.0 m of side clearance
info: On the houses and in the rear view mirrors you can see that it is a relatively steep slope. The cyclists can therefore "swing" to the left and right.StVO § 5.4 Overtaking "... When overtaking, a sufficient lateral distance to the other road users must be maintained. When overtaking with motor vehicles of pedestrians, cyclists and drivers of very small electric vehicles, the sufficient lateral distance is at least 1.5 m in towns and at least 2 m outside towns. ..."If cyclists are overtaking in built-up areas, the distance must be at least 1.5m.
text: What must you note when overtaking the cyclists in this situation?

asw_1: Only once the truck driver has used a hand signal to clearly indicate he is foregoing his right of way
asw_2: Only if I do not endanger or significantly impede the cross traffic
asw_3: Immediately, because the truck driver is prompting me to do that
info: I can't leave right away if a truck driver asks me to. First of all I have to make sure that I do not endanger or significantly obstruct cross traffic.If the truck driver then clearly gives up his right of way, I turn in front of him.
text: When may you take the turn?

asw_1: I initially halt at the stop line
asw_2: I ensure that other road users are not impeded
asw_3: Without stopping, I take the turn at walking speed
info: A single-field signal transmitter with a green arrow indicates that when the red light applies to the straight-ahead direction, it is permissible to turn to the right. Nevertheless, it is important to stop and consider that lateral traffic, cyclists and pedestrians have priority.
text: You now want to turn right at these traffic lights with a green arrow sign. What is the right course of action?

asw_1: I have to indicate
asw_2: The yellow car has to wait
asw_3: I have to wait
info: Attention, this is not a roundabout, but a so-called " unreal roundabout".It is not marked by the traffic signs "Give way" and "Roundabout". Here, as at a normal intersection, the basic rule "right before left" applies. The indicator must therefore also be activated when entering and leaving the roundabout.
text: What is the right thing to do?

asw_1: - drive up to the pedestrian crossing at a moderate speed
asw_2: - be particularly attentive
asw_3: - be ready to brake
info: The danger sign warns of a dangerous place by a crosswalk. This crosswalk can be difficult to recognize.Therefore, all three answers are correct.
text: What must you do upon seeing this traffic sign?

asw_1: The functionality of the ACC may be negatively affected
asw_2: I have to personally control my speed and distance
asw_3: The ACC stops the vehicle
info: The use of such a system requires attention from the driver so that he or she can react immediately in an emergency and, for example, increase the distance. Rain or snowfall can impair the technology. As soon as the brake or accelerator pedal is depressed, the pedal takes precedence and overrides the adaptive cruise control system.
text: While driving, you use your vehicle’s adaptive cruise control (ACC) system. What must you anticipate in these weather conditions?

asw_1: - be able to stop within half of the distance visible to me
asw_2: - stop for oncoming traffic, if necessary
asw_3: - anticipate unevenness at the edge of the road caused by tree roots
info: Avenues are often narrow, which can lead to conflicts with oncoming traffic. Due to the narrow tree planting unevenness of the road surface may occur, which can be due to the roots of the trees. In principle, you may only drive so fast that it is possible to stop within sight at any time. However, in lanes that are so narrow that oncoming vehicles could be endangered, motorists must drive so slowly that at least half of the visible distance can be maintained.
text: You are driving along a narrow avenue. What must you be aware of?

asw_1: On wide, well-finished roads
asw_2: After a long journey at high speed
asw_3: On narrow roads with uneven road surfaces
info: On wide roads without edge development, the speed of a vehicle is often estimated to be too low. Prolonged driving at high speed has a similar effect.
text: In what situation does a driver frequently underestimate their own speed?

asw_1: - red car
asw_2: - blue car
asw_3: - yellow tractor
info: Although it is not allowed, the oncoming red car has crossed the double line. A collision is possible, you must switch to the right-hand lane.
text: Why do you have to switch to the right-hand lane?

asw_1: - reduce my speed further
asw_2: - be ready to brake
asw_3: - perform an emergency braking manoeuvre
info: The deer on the left side of the road can cross the lane abruptly. I must reduce my speed further and be ready to brake.In order not to endanger the following vehicle, I do not perform emergency braking.
text: What is the correct course of action in this situation?

asw_1: I maintain my speed
asw_2: I overtake, because the road is clear
asw_3: I close the distance and sound my horn
info:
The road is not sufficiently visible because of the curve, therefore it is not allowed to overtake.

Honk only who overtakes outside built-up areas or who sees himself or others endangered.

I therefore maintain my speed.
text: The red car in front of you has been driving slowly for some time now. What is the correct course of action in this situation?

asw_1: A lack of awareness of the road traffic
asw_2: A high readiness to take risks

Because the vehicle remains on the road, it poses a danger to other motorists. Other motorists must be warned of the danger by flashing a warning light.   • country road: 100 meters
  • Freeway: 150 to 400 meters

Scheduled buses, trams and marked school buses stopping at bus stops may only be overtaken carefully, even if they are oncoming traffic.

A passenger who has left the bus appears to want to cross the roadway in front of the bus.
text: Why must you drive slowly now, and be ready to brake?

asw_1: - child
asw_2: - cyclist
asw_3: - green vehicle
info: The speed must be reduced because a child behind the vehicle parked on the right threatens to run onto the road.
text: Why are you required to brake here?

asw_1: Because the cyclist could turn off to the left
asw_2: Because I am not able to see possible oncoming traffic in good enough time
asw_3: Because of the very poor condition of the left-side road surface
info: Although the cyclist does not give a hand signal, she could turn left to follow the other cyclist.Possible oncoming traffic cannot be detected in time by the parked cars, so I am not allowed to overtake here.
text: Why are you not allowed to overtake now?

asw_1: I get ready to brake
asw_2: I watch the cyclist closely
asw_3: I manoeuvre over to the left side of the road
info: The behavior of the cyclist is not foreseeable. There is a risk that he will drive off, which would result in a collision.The oncoming vehicle prohibits a swerve to the left half of the lane.
text: What is the right course of action now?

asw_1: The driver of the yellow vehicle opens the driver-side door
asw_2: The blue truck pulls out to the left
asw_3: The cyclist pulls out to the left
info: All three answers are correct.The cyclist is very likely to swerve to the left and not stop behind the vehicle.The truck has just started and may be swerving to the left to make a turn.The vehicle has just stopped and the driver may be able to open the door.
text: What should you anticipate now?

asw_1: I continue to follow the traffic reports
asw_2: I take particular care when driving around bends and on the approach to summits
asw_3: I apply the emergency brake assist to safely stop before the tail end of the traffic jam
info: In the event of a possible traffic jam, it is important to drive with particular attention. Especially in curves and before crests, the end of the traffic jam must be expected at any time.It is also advisable to continue to follow the traffic reports.The emergency brake assistant cannot be used in a planned manner to stop safely. It intervenes automatically in a dangerous situation.
text: You are driving on a section of road where a traffic jam has been reported. What is the right course of action?

asw_1: Because of the cyclist
asw_2: Because of the pedestrians
asw_3: Because of the truck
info: The cyclist coming from the left has the right of way. That's why I have to stop.
text: Why are you required to stop now?

asw_1: I perform an emergency braking manoeuvre
asw_2: I continue driving, ready to brake
asw_3: I accelerate
info: There is a risk of collision with the cyclist coming from the left. He seems to be driving on despite the red traffic light, so that a collision can only be avoided by means of an emergency braking manoeuvre.
text: What is the correct course of action in this situation?

asw_1: I plan for regular breaks
asw_2: I drink enough
asw_3: I try to perform my trips around noon
info: Regular breaks and drink enough fluids is useful in high temperatures.At high noon, in the greatest heat to drive certainly not.
text: When ambient temperatures are high, this negatively affects driver concentration during long journeys and accident numbers rise. Which of the following is it advisable to do, so that you remain alert and can drive safely, even during high summer?

asw_1: I remain behind the cyclist
asw_2: I overtake the cyclist with a sufficient amount of side clearance
asw_3: I have to allow the pedestrian to cross the road
info: When overtaking in the inner city, you must maintain a lateral distance of at least 1.5 meters from cyclists.Since the continuous line may also not be partially crossed, overtaking the cyclist is not allowed.
text: What is the correct course of action in this situation?

asw_1: I move over to the right-hand lane after around 200 m
asw_2: I may overtake the vehicles driving in the right-hand lane
asw_3: I move into the right-hand lane now
info:
The left lane ends, two lanes merge. It is necessary to drive up to the narrowing of the lane and then merge into the right lane.

StVO § 7 Para. 4 states that the change to the continuous lane should only take place immediately before the narrowing. I may therefore overtake the vehicles in the right lane and do not yet change to the right lane.
text: What is the correct course of action in this situation?

asw_1: I allow the cyclist to pass through
asw_2: I glance over my right shoulder
asw_3: I take the turn ahead of the electric scooter
info: The StVO § 9 para. 3 clearly states here:"Anyone who wants to turn must let oncoming vehicles pass, rail vehicles, bicycles with auxiliary motors, bicycles and miniature electric vehicles even if they are traveling on or next to the roadway in the same direction."Therefore, I am not allowed to turn in front of the electric scooter and must let the cyclist pass.The shoulder view must be carried out, as I must make sure that no other road users are endangered.
text: What is the right course of action now?

asw_1: I maintain my speed
asw_2: I drive with an increased level of alertness
asw_3: I slow down to walking speed now
info: Buses on regular routes, streetcars and marked school buses that stop at bus stops may only be passed with caution, even in oncoming traffic.My speed of 30 km/h is appropriate and does not need to be reduced.The bus does not have its hazard lights on, so I do not have to drive at walking speed.
text: What is the correct course of action in this situation?<pcaption>(Hazard lights are off)</pcaption>

asw_1: I watch the pedestrians closely
asw_2: I reduce my speed and prepare to stop if necessary
asw_3: I continue driving at the same speed
info: The pedestrians appear to want to cross the street at the crosswalk and therefore have priority. By reducing my speed, I signal that the pedestrians can move onto the street.
text: What is the correct course of action in this situation?

asw_1: - leave my name and address at the scene of the accident
asw_2: - report the accident to the police
asw_3: - give my name and address to a witness not involved in the accident
info: It is necessary to wait a reasonable amount of time according to the circumstances and to leave one's name and address at the scene of the accident. In addition, the findings shall  abe made possible retrospectively without delay if one is entitled, excused or removed from the scene of the accident after the waiting period has expired. To this end, at least the entitled individuals or a nearby police station must be informed that they have been involved in the accident and given their address and the location of their vehicle. Additionally, the registration number and the location of the vehicle involved must be stated and the vehicle must be made available for immediate findings for a reasonable period of time.
text: Your vehicle has damaged someone else’s parked vehicle. Despite waiting a reasonable period of time, the owner of the damaged car fails to appear. What is the right course of action now?

asw_1: The red car
asw_2: The motorbike
asw_3: Me
info: When a police officer is directing traffic at an intersection, his instructions take precedence over all other rules, such as traffic lights and right-of-way signs.If the police officer holds both arms out to the side across the direction of travel, it means STOP. I must wait before the intersection.The motorcycle must wait because it wants to turn.The car coming from the left drives first.
text: Who has priority here?

asw_1: The green car may proceed ahead of the red car
asw_2: I may proceed ahead of the red car
asw_3: I may proceed ahead of the green car
info: The car coming from the left follows the course of the priority road and therefore has priority, it drives first.Both vehicles on the priority road have priority over me, so I drive last.
text: What is the right course of action here?

asw_1: I may proceed ahead of the red car
asw_2: The yellow car may proceed ahead of the red car
asw_3: I may proceed ahead of the yellow car
info: The vehicle coming from the right follows the course of the priority road and drives first.Since I am on the priority road, I drive in front of the vehicle coming from the left.
text: What is the right course of action here?

asw_1: The motorbike may proceed ahead of the yellow car
asw_2: I may proceed ahead of the yellow car
asw_3: I may proceed ahead of the motorbike
info: The oncoming vehicle follows the course of the turning priority road and drives first.According to the basic rule right before left, I may drive in front of the vehicle coming from the left.
text: What is the right course of action here?

asw_1: For an extended braking distance
asw_2: For the poor visibility of my vehicle
asw_3: For increased tyre traction
info: Wetness impairs visibility and thus impairs road safety. The splash water of the preceding vehicles indicates a very wet roadway. This can significantly reduce traction.
text: What should you be prepared for here?

asw_1: When driving into the truck’s wind-sheltered area
asw_2: When driving out of the truck’s wind-sheltered area
asw_3: When changing lane after overtaking
info: When driving into the slipstream of the truck, the crosswind is compensated so that the car pulls to the right. When you leave the slipstream, the crosswind returns, making counter-steering necessary.
text: Where are you particularly at risk during an overtaking manoeuvre here?

asw_1: Pedestrians on the carriageway
asw_2: A reduced amount of side clearance from oncoming traffic
asw_3: That you may be dazzled by the low-lying sun
info: There are vehicles in a car park for hikers. Therefore, one should anticipate pedestrians who may also walk on the road due to the snow. Snow and slush at the side of the road additionally narrow the roadway.
text: What must you anticipate here?

asw_1: I gently take my foot off the accelerator
asw_2: I keep the steering wheel as straight as possible
asw_3: I brake firmly
info: In the case of aquaplaning, the tire has lost contact with the road surface. Therefore, I must not steer, brake, accelerate or make any hectic driving maneuvers at this time.Carefully taking your foot off the gas pedal and keeping the steering wheel as straight as possible is the correct behavior.
text: While driving straight ahead, you lose control of your vehicle due to aquaplaning. What is the proper response now?

asw_1: Because the side clearance to the cyclists is too small
asw_2: Because I may endanger oncoming traffic
asw_3: Because I may not cross the centre line
info: A blue truck is in the oncoming lane. As a result, overtaking would endanger oncoming traffic and the necessary lateral distance of 1.5 m to the cyclists would not be possible.Thus, overtaking is out of the question.
text: Why are you not allowed to overtake here?

asw_1: Side clearances are frequently misjudged in this situation
asw_2: Vehicles with high superstructures frequently perform evasive manoeuvres to avoid branches in this situation
asw_3: Accidents involving trees are particularly frequent here
info: Due to the trees located close to the roadway, certain vehicles may be forced to use the center of the roadway. Thus, there is an increased risk of collision and, at the same time, overtaking is made more difficult.Due to the constant change of light and shade, side distances as well as oncoming traffic are often difficult to judge.Due to the many trees, tree accidents also occur more frequently in avenues.
text: You want to overtake on a tree-lined avenue. What special aspect should you bear in mind?

asw_1: I reduce my speed
asw_2: I maintain my speed
asw_3: I overtake the cyclist
info: When overtaking in inner-city traffic, you must maintain a lateral distance of at least 1.5 meters from the cyclist.Since this is not possible due to the traffic island, I reduce my speed and do not overtake the cyclist.
text: What is the right course of action now?

asw_1: - ensure that no-one else is endangered
asw_2: - look for the next suitable place to stop and park, if necessary
asw_3: - always transport hazardous goods to the destination with no intermediate stops

asw_1: - is appropriate because the overtaking vehicle can pull back into lane in front of me

info: Trains are often traveling slowly by comparison. To enable other road users to overtake safely, a distance must be maintained that allows overtaking vehicles to merge safely.In this case, the distance to the vehicle in front is appropriate and must be restored against after the overtaking maneuver.

asw_1: - the braking distance may be extended
asw_2: - the handling of the car may vary
asw_3: - my reaction time may become longer
info: The higher the weight of a vehicle, the longer the braking distance. Driving behavior, e.g. in curves, also changes with increasing weight.

asw_1: Because the hazard lights of the bus are switched on
asw_2: Because of the motorbike
asw_3: Because of the lack of road markings
info: Buses and marked school buses that are approaching a stop and have their hazard warning lights on may not be overtaken.The overtaking motorcycle is on my left, therefore I am also not allowed to overtake.The lack of lane markings is not a reason for prohibiting overtaking.

info: If you want to pass a narrowing of the road, an obstacle on the road or a stopped vehicle on the left, you must let oncoming vehicles pass.I therefore wait in front of the constricted point.

asw_3: I continue driving at a reduced speed
info: If you want to drive past a narrowing of the roadway, an obstacle on the roadway or a stopping vehicle on the left, you must allow oncoming vehicles to pass. There is not enough room to allow you to safely pass the cyclist, so you have to wait.

asw_1: - by looking in my left-hand exterior rear-view mirror before opening the door
asw_2: - by glancing over my left shoulder before opening the door
asw_3: - just by looking through the slightly opened door

info: Anyone getting on or off the vehicle must behave in such a way that there is no risk to other road users.This requires looking over the shoulder and observing the traffic in the left-hand side mirror.

asw_2: I close the windows
asw_3: I activate the child-safety lock
info: Motor vehicles must be secured against unauthorized use. Therefore, windows must be closed and doors locked.

asw_1: - blue indicator lamp
asw_2: - green indicator lamp
asw_3: - red indicator lamp

asw_3: At taxi ranks

asw_3: I turn on my indicator in plenty of time

asw_1: - makes it easier to document the accident with foreign-speaking parties involved in the accident
asw_2: - enables the parties involved to independently document the accident
asw_3: - unambiguously clarifies the issue of liability at the scene of the accident
asw_pretext: Because, in the event of an accident, the European accident report form
info: The European accident report is a standardized form used throughout Europe to document the course of an accident.It facilitates and enables the recording of the accident, especially when different languages are spoken.Each party involved in the accident fills out an accident report and each party receives a copy of the completed report.The information provided is not an admission of guilt, and the question of liability is not clarified by the accident report.
text: Why should you always carry the European accident report form with you on your journey?

asw_1: I drive over to the right-side as far as possible
asw_2: I reduce my speed
asw_3: I stop immediately
info: Blue flashing light together with the emergency horn orders: "All other road users must clear the way immediately".Since there is no oncoming traffic in sight, drive as far to the right as possible and reduce speed sufficiently in this situation.Stopping is not necessary.

asw_2: - am driving on a designated diversionary route
asw_3: - am able to comply with the driving and rest periods by doing so

asw_1: - increases range
asw_2: - conserves the service brake system
asw_3: - means that energy can be recovered from the braking operation
info: Recuperation refers to a technical process for recovering energy.In electric vehicles, the electric motor becomes a generator as soon as the foot is taken off the gas pedal while driving.  Electrical energy is recovered and fed back into the battery.Depending on the recuperation strength set, braking is stepped up and more electricity is generated.The service brake system is spared because it is used less often.
text: What is the benefit of recuperation in an electric vehicle?

asw_1: Any change to the gear ratio of the pinion and chain wheel

asw_2: - evenly distributes the torque to the driving wheels
asw_3: - improves handling during cornering

asw_1: There will be a considerable deterioration in the vehicle’s manoeuvrability
asw_2: The vehicle’s stability will be dangerously reduced when cornering

info: If the tire pressure is significantly too low, the tire loses its stability. This worsens driving stability and steering behavior.Tire wear increases sharply and does not decrease.
